item.title: Could we please have some clear signage with an update on the situation?, 29th July
item.description:
It would be helpful if some signage was put up explaing the ongoing delays? It would help alleviate some of the frustration and delays and ongoing inconvenience. Perhaps placed on signs near the Traffic Lights? Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 86, Crofton Lane, Poverest, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter, 29th July
item.description:
There is litter on the green all the way from Wickham lane to the edge of Bostall heath. It looks really unsightly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rutherglen Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Fly tipping in empty plant yard, 29th July
item.description:

item.title: Pothole not fixed properly, 29th July
item.description:
On Rodney Road, at the junction with Victory Place, some potholes were poorly repaired. The tarmac hasn’t been laid properly and is not level with the pavement, creating a hazard as it’s easy to trip over.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rodney Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street not cleared, 29th July
item.description:
Someone has just come to strim the overgrown weeds on the access road between 34 and 36 Arcadian Avenue. Unfortunately they haven't cleared up where they strimmed but just left the rubbish laying in the road. This is a public footway leading to the footbridge across the A2. It really needs weed killing as well.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arcadian Avenue, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous slabs, 29th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4,2, Durnsford Road, London

item.title: Half a job, 29th July
item.description:
I have noticed that council marked half of the damaged on the pavement that will need to be replaced, so that means that pavement will be better, but still damaged and dangerous. Why council is doing half a job, wasting public money and still leaving dangerous pavement. This stretch of pavement been damaged continuously, so ideally need to be replaced with tarmac to match other side of the road and must be done correctly with the right type of subase not a sand.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Duncroft, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
